<RESUME_START>
CONSTRUCTION AND DESIGN PROJECT MANAGER

SUMMARY

Seasoned Design and Construction Project Manager with more than 13 years' experience in managing multimillion
projects in the US and abroad. Expertise in coordinating and overseeing all aspects of design and construction, from
conceptualization to completion, while providing continuous status reports to business owners and investors. Proven
track record of achieving construction goals and consistently completing projects on time and budget. Fluency in
English and Italian with working knowledge of Spanish and French. Seeking to leverage success and experience to take
next career step in a challenging project management position with a respected institution in Connecticut.

SKILLS

Sage Timberline Software, Compeat, QuickBooks, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access)

EXPERIENCE

Construction and Design Project Manager

10/2002 to Current
Company Name
City ,
State
Oversee all facets of project management for several multimillion-dollar restaurant and residential projects in
New York City and London, including contract negotiations and administration, project estimation, material
purchasing, budget management, and site management; managed design and construction for 10 projects to
date. Coordinate with owner and investors during pre-construction phase to develop requirements, scopes of work, and
budgets; execute and manage budget and schedules from conception to completion. Organize trades, procure source materials, and liaise between owner, principal architect, designers, engineers,
subcontractors, and vendors.
Partner with architects to solicit bids for construction and design, assess bids, and award contracts.
Manage selection and hiring of design and construction subcontractors, and work with both teams to achieve
milestones on time and on budget. Document observations and photograph ongoing design and construction work, produce field reports, and
regularly communicate project status to internal partners weekly. Investigate issues and expedite resolution to maintain timelines and budgets; develop strategies to prevent
recurrence of issues. Research and commission artisans to build site specific and custom objects for interior and exterior design and
décor. Source and purchase materials from international vendors, and purchase and coordinate material shipments from
vendors to construction sites. Ensure compliance with requisite regulations, including federal, state, and local building codes and safety
guidelines.
Past experience includes Education Program Coordinator at Solomon R.
Guggenheim Museum, Office
Manager at Cranmer Art Conservation, Inc., and Assistant Program Manager at Trinity College.

EDUCATION AND TRAINING

Bachelor of Arts :
Museum Studies and Art History Art History Italian
The City College of New York
City ,
State
Museum Studies and Art History Art History Italian
The University of Vermont
City ,
State
Dean's List

CERTIFICATIONS

Design and Construction
Budget Development and Management
Project Management
Requests for Proposal and Estimation
Contract Negotiations and Administration
Sourcing and Procurement

SKILLS

architect, Art, budget management, Budget Development and Management, budgets, budget, building codes, Contract Negotiations, contracts, Design and Construction, hiring, materials, Access, Excel, Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Office
Manager, Procurement, Project Management, Proposal, purchasing, QuickBooks, Research, safety, Sage, Solomon, Timberline
<RESUME_END>

<JD_START>
Job Title: Service Manager - Maintenance and Snow Removal at Ascape Landscape and Construction

Location: Blauvelt, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Management

Description:
This position is posted on behalf of People Solutions Center's client, Ascape Landscape and Construction. Ascape Landscape and Construction Corporation is seeking a Service Manager to oversee the administration of our snow removal and maintenance efforts.  Our Service Manager - Maintenance and Snow removal at Ascape Landscape and Construction will play an essential role in the day-to-day operations of our maintenance and snow removal divisions.  About Us:Ascape Landscape and Construction Corporation was founded in 1984. We are a commercial and residential landscape construction and maintenance business with an established reputation for service and quality. We believe in focusing on success and providing a best-in-class landscape services to our clients across the New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, and Pennsylvania area. Why work for Ascape Landscape and Construction as our Service Manager - Maintenance and Snow Removal?  We offer a robust compensation and benefits package for this role, with a yearly starting salary of $65,000 per year with opportunity for growth. We also offer health benefits after 90 days, and a 401k with a 4% employer match, paid time off, and vacation time. Our Service Manager - Maintenance and Snow Removal will have a Monday-Friday schedule from approximately 8am to 5pm. Requirements for the Service Manager - Maintenance and Snow Removal at Ascape Landscape and Construction: 3-5 years of experience working in office administration in a related industry such as construction, landscaping, plumbing, electric etc… A High School Diploma/GED required; an associates or higher is preferred Intermediate/proficient experience in Excel Basic technical knowledge and the ability to sit behind a computer for 8 hours Excellent written, verbal, and auditory communication skillsExcellent attention to detail with large and small amounts of dataProficient with using technology including CRM, Microsoft Office, Microsoft Outlook, and AdobeJob Duties for the Service Manager – Maintenance and Snow Removal at Ascape Landscape and Construction: Scheduling appointments with customers for technician visits and coordinating as a liaison between customers and technicians Tracking all technician schedules Building proposals for the Operations Manager to review Managing client relationships including handling client complaints and resolving client issues in coordination with the Operations Manager Accounts Receivables for maintenance and snow removal projects including entering client payment information and tracking billing and invoicing on client accountsCoordinating payments and deposits with the bookkeeping department Collecting work orders from technicians and entering job times and work order details into the systemActing as a back up for phone system; answering phone calls from maintenance and snow removal customersOther duties as assigned

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
